title: Part a.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for calculating the required reserves: $20,000.
descriptions:
No point earned.

One point is earned for calculating the required reserves: $20,000.

Earns 1 of 1 point.

One point is earned for calculating the required reserves: $20,000.

title: Part b.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for calculating the maximum amount of additional loans that Bank of Uchenna can make as $10,000 (=$30,000 - $20,000).
descriptions:
No point earned.

One point is earned for calculating the maximum amount of additional loans that Bank of Uchenna can make as $10,000 (=$30,000 - $20,000).

Earns 1 of 1 point.

One point is earned for calculating the maximum amount of additional loans that Bank of Uchenna can make as $10,000 (=$30,000 - $20,000).

title: Part c.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for stating that there will be no change in the money supply.
descriptions:
No point earned.

One point is earned for stating that there will be no change in the money supply.

Earns 1 of 1 point.

One point is earned for stating that there will be no change in the money supply.

title: Part d.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for stating that the maximum change in demand deposits in the banking system is $25,000 (= $5,000 x 5).
descriptions:
No point earned.

One point is earned for stating that the maximum change in demand deposits in the banking system is $25,000 (= $5,000 x 5).

Earns 1 of 1 point.

One point is earned for stating that the maximum change in demand deposits in the banking system is $25,000 (= $5,000 x 5).

title: Part e.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for stating that Bank of Uchenna can borrow from other banks to meet its reserve requirements or borrow from the central bank.
descriptions:
No point earned.

One point is earned for stating that Bank of Uchenna can borrow from other banks to meet its reserve requirements or borrow from the central bank.

Earns 1 of 1 point.

One point is earned for stating that Bank of Uchenna can borrow from other banks to meet its reserve requirements or borrow from the central bank.
